subject: RE: [junit] Asserting object equality in junit 3.8.1
msgSnippet: ok, thank s! To: junit@yahoogroups.com From: chris.dollin@hp.com Date: Wed, 4 Mar 2009 12:03:50 +0000 Subject: Re: [junit] Asserting object equality in junit
messageBody:
ok, thank s!

To: junit@yahoogroups.com
From: chris.dollin@...
Date: Wed, 4 Mar 2009 12:03:50 +0000
Subject: Re: [junit] Asserting object equality in junit 3.8.1





















On Tuesday 03 March 2009 06:58:41 pm rognedaerzula wrote:

> Hi Everyone,

>

> can anyone tell me how to assert equality of two objects such as array

> of bytes

> or Files in junit 3.8.1?

>

> using

> Assert.assertEquals(File1, File2) or assertEquals(bytearray1,

> bytearray2) always states that objects are not equal..

>

> is this method supposed to compare 'content' or that it is actually

> referincing same object? - there is an assertSame method - so would think

> assertEquals should compare content



It does, but to do so it uses the objects .equals() method (how else?),

so it requires that that method do something sensible. If it doesn't,

you'll probably end up writing your own method:



public void assertMyEqualsForFilesOrWhatever( Thing exp, Thing act )

{

if (!mySuitableEqualityTest( exp, act ))

fail( mySuitableDifferenceMessage( exp, act ) );

}



--
